contact.name: Paul Pinho
contact.bio: I'm an all around web developer, full stack senior programmer with good knowledge of front-end techniques. I love structure and order, I also stand for quality. I love spending time on fixing little details and optimizing web apps. Also, I like working on a team, you'll learn faster and much more. As the saying goes: 'two heads are better than one'.

education.description: This course taught me a range of valuable skills and concepts that can be applied in several ways to many businesses and industries. The challenging curriculum covered a full-stack, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Java, jQuery, PHP, Node.js, Responsive Design, Heroku, Git, User Authentication, React.js, MySQL, and MongoDB.

The education was mainly Mathematics, but I also learned about Java-based programming, object oriented programming, SQL and more. During my time in college, I specialized in Pure Math. Here I learned about algorithms -the importance of how and why things work the way they do.

I graduated high school, where I enjoyed doing science, math, biology and arts. I realized in my third year of school that I enjoyed solving complex problems and wanted to do something with mathematics. I also learned computer programming and started making small flash/actionscript applications.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Followed my passion for building highly scalable API's by taking up a new role within Optum. I joined an initiative to modernize legacy API's and migrate them to Azure. Worked on building micro-services which powered our member portals and mobile applications.

work.title: Quality Engineer
work.description: Transitioned from analyst to engineer. I began working with a quality tech stack which included Java, Selenium, and Cucumber. Developed Gherkin scripts to simulate the member healthcare enrollment process through various web portals. Stored data to create applications in a back-end MySQL database. Ran hundreds of parallel scripts, in a Jenkins CI/CD pipeline, hosted in a Docker container, and executed via Saucelabs.

work.title: Sr IT Quality Analyst
work.description: As a senior employee, I took on more of a leadership role. I lead teams to meet deliverable due dates. In an effort to transition from Waterfall to Agile methodology, I also began working with test automation framework, such as Selenium and Cucumber.

work.title: Assc IT Systems Analyst
work.description: Worked through several disciplines of the Claims Quality Assurance organization. On the Delivery team I work with business users, system analysts, designers and programmers to create and analyze various required project documents. While achieving my Green Belt certification, I developed an application that automated some of the redundant processes in Release Management. On the Consumer Centric Testing (CCT) team, I developed various Access databases to test large volumes of claims and assisted the analyst as a Subject Matter Expert on the Facets Application.

work.title: Contractor US Contingent
work.description: Went through a comprehensive 3 month training program that included an overview of health care, corporate technology basics, software development and testing. Once training concluded I was placed in a role where I participate in production implementation verification and being accountable for validating system quality.

projects.title: Marvel Adventure
projects.description: Marvel Adventure, is a brief role play game set up in the Marvel Universe.

projects.title: Hangman
projects.description: Hangman game based on Marvel characters.

projects.title: Infinity War
projects.description: An online game specially for the Infinity Stones.
